member.name: T:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis
member.summary: Main class of the PDF Metamorphosis .Net. Allows to export Text, RTF, DOCX, DOC and HTML to PDF; split and merge PDF documents.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.HtmlSetting
member.summary: Set options necessary for HTML to PDF conversion, such as BaseUrl etc.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.HtmlSetting.BaseUrl
member.summary: The part of document’s URL preceding its name. Default value: .
member.remarks:
URL assigned to a page to convert "relative URLs" into "absolute URLs" by the addition of a document name or trailing slash /.
It’s very important to set this property when converting HTML document in memory in order to determine where all relative URLs are pointing to and convert them to absolute.
For example, let's convert HTML string to a PDF file.
Assuming we've specified:
p.HtmlOptions.BaseUrl = @"d:\my webs";
Now when the component meets 'src="images/asterisk.jpg"' it will try to load an image from: "d:\my webs\images\asterisk.jpg"

code.source: ..\Packages\PDF Metamorphosis .Net\Code samples\CSharp\04. HTML to PDF\04. ASP.Net - Convert HTML to PDF\Default.aspx.cs
code.title: Using the property BaseUrl in ASP.Net application using C#

code.source: ..\Packages\PDF Metamorphosis .Net\Code samples\VB.Net\04. HTML to PDF\04. ASP.Net - Convert HTML to PDF\Default.aspx.vb
code.title: Using the property BaseUrl in ASP.Net application using VB.Net

member.name: T:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PageSetting.PageNumbers
member.summary: Allows to set page numbers and their properties in PDF.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PageSetting.PageNumbers.Text
member.summary: Set a custom page numbers in produced PDF document. Default value: "".
member.remarks:
Default value: empty string
Using this property you may set custom page numbers as you wish.
These are special keywords to custom page numbers:
{page} - current page number
{numpages} - total pages

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.HeadersFooters.FromHtmlURL(System.String)
member.summary: Set header/footer from HTML URL.
member.param: URL as string
member.remarks: We don't recommend to use it for complex HTML documents. The best is using a simple HTML table with text and images as header/footer.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.HeadersFooters.FromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Set header/footer from local RTF file
member.param: Path to local RTF file
member.remarks: This method is very usefull when you want to insert header/footer from existing RTF document.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfPermissions
member.summary: Specifies the operations that are allowed to a user on an encrypted PDF document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfPermissions.DisallowAll
member.summary: Disallows all operations on the PDF document. This is the default value.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfPermissions.AllowAll
member.summary: Allows all operations on the PDF document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfPermissions.ContentCopy
member.summary: Allows copying or otherwise extracting text and graphics from the document, including extraction for accessibility purposes.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfPermissions.ContentCopyForAccessibility
member.summary: Allows extract text and graphics in support of accessibility to disabled users or for other purposes. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option is ignored and accessibility is allowed whenever ContentCopy is set.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfPermissions.ModifyContents
member.summary: Allows modifying the document’s contents.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfPermissions.ModifyAnnotations
member.summary: Allows adding or modifying text annotations. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option also allows filling in form fields.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfPermissions.FillIn
member.summary: Allows filling in forms and signing the document. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option is ignored and filling in form is allowed whenever ModifyAnnotations is set.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfPermissions.DocumentAssembly
member.summary: Allows assembling the document: inserting, rotating, or deleting pages and creating navigation elements such as bookmarks or thumbnail images. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option is ignored and document assembly is allowed when ModifyContents is set.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfPermissions.Printing
member.summary: Allows printing the document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfPermissions.HighResolutionPrinting
member.summary: Allows printing the document to the highest resolution possible. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option is ignored and high resolution printing is allowed when Printing is set.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies the encryption algorithm to use for encrypting a PDF document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm.RC4_40
member.summary: RC4 encryption, key length of 40 bits.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm.RC4_128
member.summary: RC4 encryption, key length of 128 bits.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSecurity
member.summary: Contains details for encrypting and access permissions for a PDF document, such as Password, Permissions etc.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSecurity.EncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies the encryption algorithm to use. The default value is .

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSecurity.OwnerPassword
member.summary: Specifies the owner password for the encrypted PDF document.

remarks.para: The owner password allows the user to open an encrypted PDF document without any access restrictions specified in .
The owner password cannot be the same as the user password. If you don't specify an owner password, then the system will generate a random password when generating the PDF document.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSecurity.UserPassword
member.summary: Specifies the user password required for opening the encrypted PDF document.

remarks.para: The user password will be required to open an encrypted PDF document for viewing. The permissions specified in will be enforced by the reader software.
The user password can be null or empty string, in this case no password will be required from the user when opening the PDF document. The user password cannot be the same as the owner password.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSecurity.Permissions
member.summary: Specifies the operations that are allowed to a user on an encrypted PDF document. The default value is .

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.PdfVersions.PDF_14
member.summary: The output file will comply with the PDF 1.4 standard.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.PdfVersions.PDF_15
member.summary: The output file will comply with the PDF 1.5 standard.

member.summary: The output file will comply with the PDF 1.6 standard.

member.summary: The output file will comply with the PDF/A-1a (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PDF/A) standard.

member.summary: The output file will comply with the PDF/A-2a (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PDF/A) standard.

member.summary: The output file will comply with the PDF/A-2b (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PDF/A) standard.

member.summary: The output file will comply with the PDF/A-2u (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PDF/A) standard.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.PdfVersions.PDF_A3a
member.summary: The output file will comply with the PDF/A-3a (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PDF/A) standard.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.PdfVersions.PDF_A3b
member.summary: The output file will comply with the PDF/A-3b (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PDF/A) standard.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.EmbedAllFonts
member.summary: Embed all used fonts inside the PDF document. Default value: false.
member.remarks: This makes the PDF document completely standalone and independent of fonts installed on the computer where the PDF document will be opened.

code.title: How to embed all fonts inside PDF document in VB.Net

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.ClipboardTextProtection
member.summary: Gets and sets the protection on copying of all text from PDF document through clipboard. Default value: false.
member.remarks: In case of true, it's impossible to copy text to the clipboard from resulting PDF. Important: The PDF document can be displayed incorrectly in some editors and converted back to Word also incorrectly.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.Compression
member.summary: Allows to set compression type to change size of the PDF document. Default value: true.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.JpegQuality
member.summary: Specify the image quality from 1 ... 100. Allows to reduce the size of PDF document due to loss of quality of embedded images. Default value: 90.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.FontsDirectory
member.summary: Full local path to fonts directory (any folder with *.ttf files). Default value: Fonts directory of the current OS.
member.remarks:
Advice for developers who creates ASP.Net or Silverlight projects:
Some hosting providers disables any access to windows directories. For example, GoDaddy doesn't allow to read directory "Windows\Fonts".
We recommend to create own "Fonts" directory in your project and copy *.ttf files to it from "Windows\Fonts". You may copy only several fonts, but we recommend to put the font "Arial Unicode MS" - ARIALUNI.TTF anyway.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PdfSetting.PdfProducer
member.summary: Set producer in an output document.

member.summary: Sets the password in the resulting file.

1 - can't open input DOC file, check the input path.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.MergePDFFileArrayToPDFFile(System.String[],System.String)
member.summary: Merge several PDF files into a single PDF file
member.param: Array of paths to PDF documents
Path to resulting PDF, it will be created by the component or overwritten if the PDF document already exists
member.returns:
0 - merged successfully
1 - error, can't merge PDF documents
2 - error, can't create output file, probably it used by another application
3 - merging failed
4 - merged successfully, but some files were not merged

code.source: ..\Packages\PDF Metamorphosis .Net\Code samples\CSharp\07. Split and Merge PDF\02. Split and Merge PDF\sample.cs

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.MergePDFFileToPDFFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Merge two PDF files. Merge File1Path and DestFile file into a single DestFile.
member.param: Path to an existing PDF file
Path to a second PDF file to merge the first file into
member.remarks: If the second file does not already exist the component just copies the first file to a new name
member.returns:
0 - merged successfully
1 - error, can't merge PDF documents
2 - error, can't create output file, probably it used by another application
3 - merging failed

member.name: M:SautinSoft.PdfMetamorphosis.PrintPdf(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Print the PDF file using the default printer with time settings
member.param: Path to the PDF file to be printed
Timeout in seconds to load Adobe Reader
Timeout in seconds to send PDF document on print
